The source of the claim: The expert examined the source of the claim, which was a Facebook page called The India Eye with over 1.8 million followers. They noted the date of the post and the number of shares it had received as an indication of its reach and potential impact.
Social media circulation: The expert mentioned that the claim had been widely shared on social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter. They highlighted the fact that many right-wing users had tweeted the image, including one who was followed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. This information helped assess the potential influence and spread of the claim.
Image analysis: The expert conducted a reverse image search on Google to verify the authenticity of the photograph. They found that the circulating image had been photoshopped, with the addition of the words "शव वाहिनी" (mortuary van) on the vehicle. By comparing the photoshopped image with the original image from a news report, they were able to identify the alterations made.
Contextual information: The expert provided additional context by mentioning that the photoshopped image was linked to the Jan Jagran Yatra, a mass outreach program of the Congress party ahead of the Madhya Pradesh assembly election. This information helped to understand the timing and potential motives behind the circulation of the claim.
